pros: Great people, Great leadership team and amazing product
cons: Not many that I can think of

pros: Great leadership and even better culture.

review_title: Good work culture but industry headwinds
pros:
Open work culture.
Good engineering team.
Great food.
cons:
Not a stellar growth maybe due to the market in which the company operates.
Lot of pressure to get things done (GSD) but poor organizational structure to accomplish it.
Many old timers left creating a vacuum

pros: Flexibility, autonomy, benefits, company values and people. Focus on Customer POV and needs
cons: No 401k match. In a transition period currently
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to place value on blowing customer minds. From everyone front facing to engineering. Love the focus on company values and the passion of employees and leadership

pros: great culture, very supportive, good office environment
cons: hard to sell the vision of an expensive "nice to have" in eyes of customers

pros: Nice 'starter' tech company with good place to learn how to work in tech
cons: Should leave due to limited upside

review_title: Great Culture and People! Pay equality needs work
pros: Great culture and people. Boxers are smart, caring, and motivating to work with. Make mom proud culture really carries throughout work.
cons: Pay equality and employee growth within the company needs work. Leadership is mostly older white males and there is a lot of talk, but not a huge effort to hire diverse Boxers.
advice_to_mgmt: Hire more diverse talent and promote diversity from within!

review_title: Couldn't imagine a better place to work
pros: Never have I worked somewhere where everybody is friendly, cares about your success, and are some of the smartest people around. I think the leadership really makes an effort to make every employee feel valued and special, and I'm all about that.
cons: Still trying to figure out our product-market fit is tough, but this is part of the growing pains

review_title: Great place to work butt questionable middle management
pros:
Some amazing people work here at box. It's a good learning experience to interact with them.
Company values reflect in most teams interactions
Great in+house kitchen and snack options
Amazing benefits but no 401k matching
cons:
Middle management feels inexperienced both for product and engineering orgs
Lack of clear direction in terms of product growth from higher management
Getting rid of non performers is really hard and this drags the teams down
advice_to_mgmt:
Finalize a strategy and go for it. Please don't change the course every year
Fix the engineering org issues by focusing on quality of crucial existing services instead of building new products for showcase
Please fill the long vacant positions. Many teams don't have managers or PMs that interact on a daily basis and that's clearly not working

pros: High salary for new grads software engineer. Good benefits. Nice culture. Manager and coworkers really care about you.
cons: Can't think of any at this time.

review_title: Box is a great company with excellent benefits and competitive salary.
pros: Competitive salary, great people, great product, great training.
cons: No cons yet, will update if any arise.

review_title: Great low stress environment, disorganization in some (not all) orgs
pros:
- great work/life balance
- free food, flexible hours
- unlimited vacation (can be pro or con depending on your manager)
- solid vision, company will grow
- friendly people, great culture
- very competitive pay
- least stressful job I've read
cons:
- company is becoming more corporatey
- no 401k matching
- different organizations vary greatly. Some are run super well, have no politics, GSD. Others are super disorganized.
- bar for hiring engineers has been dropping.
- sales and product have a lot of politics, engineering it varies but much less so
- lots of tech debt, will take years to overcome at current rate

pros: Solid mentorship, great people, really enjoyed time there
cons: It felt like company growth was slowing down

review_title: Solid tech company to work for

pros:
* Great pay, benefits
* Everyone is passionate about the company mission of improving the way people work
* Executive leadership is often inspiring
* Lots of options for things to work on
cons: No real cons that I can think of

pros: Boxers walk the talk and live Box values, from the top down.
cons: They look after their people but they don’t throw cash around on excessive benefits.

review_title: A company with good intentions but still falls short
pros: Employee resource groups, free lunch, snacks, unlimited PTO
cons: talks a big game but actions don't always match up; Being promoted as a minority is very challenging, they say they are working on this but their numbers prove otherwise. not a terrible place to work but after your first year, the cons start to outweigh the pros
advice_to_mgmt: ACTION! All of the good ideas and thoughts, make them actionable and hold yourselves accountable for when you fall short. This was actually a good place to work for awhile but management has too many empty promises.

pros: Great teams, environment, perks and culture. You have a ton of support and great resources available.
cons: It is just a challenging product to actually sell.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to help craft the messaging through training.

review_title: Box- Where PM Careers Go To Die
pros:
Free lunch
Caltrain pass
Generous ESPP
Gym/Phone Reimbursement
cons:
The product team is a turnstile. Both Long-tenured PMs and new PMs (less than a half a year) are leaving or are looking. Most individual contributors have been burnt on empty promises. You’ll soon realize that you’re really just a chess piece amongst dueling VPs and directors. May the odds ever be in your favor. You might just luck out.

In addition, former acqui-hires who left the company were threatened via lawsuit because they left too quick. Seriously Box, they left because y’all treated them like BLEEP.

If you don’t believe me, I’d encourage you to reach out to former PMs before accepting the job.
advice_to_mgmt: Pick a product strategy. Our PM leaders are power hungry, and they’re making selfish decisions, causing fallout for everyone else.
